newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: BANK OF QLD RAISES A$30 MLN IN NOTE ISSUE.
newsitem.headline: BANK OF QLD RAISES A$30 MLN IN NOTE ISSUE.

text.p: Bank of Queensland Ltd said on Tuesday that it raised A$30 million through the issue of 10-year capital notes in the Australian debt market.
The issue, which was arranged and lead managed by Westpac Banking Corp, was fully placed with investors prior to today's settlement and was well oversubscribed, the bank said.

The notes, which have a 10-year maturity, are callable by the issuer after five years. They are priced at a margin of 45 basis points over 90 day bank bill swap rate, stepping up to 90 basis points after the first call date, it said.
The subordination is structured so the notes qualify as Tier 2 capital for capital adequacy purposes, it said.
Bank of Queensland is rated BBB-plus by Standard & Poors.
